title: Textile, 1740s
medium:
Medium: Silk
Technique: Predominantly warp-faced plain weave patterned by discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading) bound on the front in 1/2 twill
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 113.7 x 53.3 cm (44 3/4 x 21 in.)
Repeat H: 42.5 cm (16 3/4 in.) repeated by placing vertically mirrored images one over the other
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Delicate curving stems of flowers in bright shades of pink and blue on a cream background.

exhibitions.title: The Huguenot Legacy: English Silver, 1680-1760 from the Alan & Simone Hartman Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1740s.
1740s. Medium: Silk
Technique: Predominantly warp-faced plain weave patterned by discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading) bound on the front in 1/2 twill. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 1981-39-1.
